safety_edibility_notes: Protected species. Trade regulated under CITES. Historically hunted for feathers by indigenous peoples.
safety_warning_text: Macaws have powerful beaks capable of crushing nuts and can inflict serious bite wounds. Bites can remove fingers or cause deep lacerations. Most bites occur from captive birds.
safety_summary: Wild macaws avoid humans. Captive macaws can bite hard enough to cause serious injury. Their powerful beaks can exert over 500 PSI. Proper handling training is essential for captive birds.
safety_contraindications: Never grab at or chase macaws
Learn proper handling techniques before interacting
encounter_protocol: Wild: observe from distance. Captive: move slowly, speak softly, allow bird to approach. Never force interaction.
